text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Iraqi press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Uday Saddam Hussein receives senior officials, among them a vice-president and a minister.
- Vice-President Taha Yassin Ramadan says Iraq is the liberated bastion and bulwark in the face of aggression from both Israel and America.
- Tareq Aziz receives a Jordanian personality.
- Moslem feast of al-Adha starts on Thursday in Iraq.
- Iraqi plane makes first international flight since the imposition of the unfair embargo.
- The flight of the pilgrim plane to Saudi Arabia captures world-wide attention.
- Diplomats and journalists at the United Nations express admiration for Iraq's decision to send a pilgrim plane to Saudi Arabia.
- Jordanian foreign minister meets Iraqi ambassador.
(The above were also carried by THAWRA and AL-IRAQ)
- Editorial on the meanings of Baath party.
- Article on the roots of Zionist extremism and its link to aggression and expansion.
- Commentary praises Russia for positive stand vis-a-vis Iraq sanctions.
- Commentary attacks United States for adopting policy of double standards in dealing with Iraq.
- Article attempts to explain link between Arabs as a nation and Islam as a religion.
